translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The citizen Antônio José de Abreu states that it becomes necessary for the respective clerk, in view of the records of the collection of the goods of the late intestate José Augusto Ledek, to provide him with a certificate of the dispatch in which the Petitioner was appointed Curator of the remaining estate of the said deceased, the day, month, and year in which he took the oath, as well as the day and year in which those goods were deposited in the hands of Major Bernardo Pires, and finally the dispatch by which the Petitioner was discharged from the position of Curator.

He respectfully requests of Your Lordship

I hope to receive Your Grace

Pass. Piratini, October 2, 1841. Freitas

No. 2 The citizen Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro, Clerk of Orphans and Absentees of the city of Piratini and its district. By virtue of the aforesaid dispatch: I certify that the goods mentioned by the petitioner were deposited in the possession of citizen Major Bernardo Pires on the twenty-fourth of last September, as appears in the records on page eleven. Furthermore, I certify, and it appears in the same records on page fourteen, that the petitioner was appointed Curator and took the oath on the twenty-fifth of the mentioned month of September. I finally certify that from the aforesaid records on page twenty-one verso it appears that the petitioner was discharged from such curatorship on the first day of the current month of October, and replaced by the aforementioned citizen Major Bernardo Pires. The foregoing is true and I refer to the pertinent records. Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro
